text: hi today I have a really fun recipe it's
a one pan meal all made in the broiler
it's broiled salmon with asparagus and
shitake mushrooms and it couldn't be
more delicious start off with 1 pound of
asparagus and obviously four pieces of
salmon beautiful salmon please try to
get wild if you can very very good trim
your asparagus I'm gonna snap and I
usually cut but today I'm gonna snap
because I can see that these are kind of
long ish tough parts and I don't want
that
my broiler is preheating and I have an
ovenproof skillet that I'm using to cook
this all in cut your asparagus in half
that and add to a pan with 12 ounces of
shitake mushrooms this is a large
straight sided skillet it's perfect for
this job
season with a little bit of salt and
pepper don't overdo it because there's
soy sauce in the sauce so just a tiny
bit and then drizzle with a couple of
tablespoons of safflower oil now
normally I use olive oil but I want to
use a neutral flavor oil for this recipe
because it has sort of an Asian flavor
profile and olive oil would not taste
good here give this a toss and then get
it into your broiler and it's gonna cook
for about five minutes or so before you
continue and add some more ingredients
now for the sauce great time to make it
as well that is starting to broil this
is 1/4 cup of soy sauce 3 tablespoons of
sugar it's kind of like a teriyaki ish
flavor profile and then 3 tablespoons of
lemon juice so it's sweet salty and
tangy all great things this was semi
juicy lemon I think one lemon is good
for 3 tablespoons of juice and then some
fresh ginger about 2 teaspoons of grated
fresh ginger for this recipe you'll need
about 1 inch stir those together you
just want the sugar to dissolve and then
your sauce is ready that's gonna get
tossed with the vegetables and then at
the very end for a few minutes I'm going
to add
salmon and these are for about five
ounce pieces of salmon about 1 inch
thick Wow look at that took down so much
hasn't it it's amazing how much moisture
is in mushrooms and asparagus drizzle
with the sauce and then give it a toss
and then back into the broiler for about
another three minutes salmon really
doesn't take very long to cook so you
want to make sure that your veggies are
all nice and cooked and a little bit
charred even before you add your salmon
now the salmon comes along that's got
nice browning on it very very good place
your salmon on top sort of nestled it in
if you need to season with a little bit
of salt not too much like I said don't
forget about the soy sauce but I always
think that soy sauce has a certain kind
of saltiness and salt salt has a
different kind and I often use both
drizzle with just a little bit of oil
and then a little bit of the sauce from
the pan and you can see how quick and
easy this was the prep was basically
nothing so just get this back into the
oven while the broiler actually and it
should take about 3 to 5 minutes for the
salmon to cook I'm really excited I
don't know about you but that was one of
the easiest things that I've made all
year and now all that's left is to eat
it that's the really fun part what do
you think about that isn't it beautiful
let's taste it mm-hmm it's so good the
mushrooms really add a lot of depth of
flavor to this dish you are not gonna
believe how easy it is you're gonna love
making it it's gonna be your new
favorite salmon dish
you
